Work may involve reviewing contracts to ascertain service, machine, and workforce requirements; answering inquiries from potential customers regarding methods, material, and price ranges; and preparing estimates according to labor, material, and machine costs.
37-1012.ex: Grounds Maintenance Supervisor, Head Greenskeeper, Horticultural Services Supervisor
37-1012.title: First-Line Supervisors of Landscaping, Lawn Service, and Groundskeeping Workers

37-2000._label: Building Cleaning and Pest Control Workers

37-2011.desc: Keep buildings in clean and orderly condition. Perform heavy cleaning duties, such as cleaning floors, shampooing rugs, washing walls and glass, and removing rubbish. Duties may include tending furnace and boiler, performing routine maintenance activities, notifying management of need for repairs, and cleaning snow or debris from sidewalk.
37-2011.ex: Industrial Plant Custodian, School Custodian, Window Washer
37-2011.title: Janitors and Cleaners, Except Maids and Housekeeping Cleaners

37-2012.desc: Perform any combination of light cleaning duties to maintain private households or commercial establishments, such as hotels and hospitals, in a clean and orderly manner. Duties may include making beds, replenishing linens, cleaning rooms and halls, and vacuuming.
37-2012.title: Maids and Housekeeping Cleaners

37-2019.desc: All building cleaning workers not listed separately.
37-2019.title: Building Cleaning Workers, All Other

37-2021.desc: Apply or release chemical solutions or toxic gases and set traps to kill or remove pests and vermin that infest buildings and surrounding areas.
37-2021.title: Pest Control Workers

37-3011.desc: Landscape or maintain grounds of property using hand or power tools or equipment. Workers typically perform a variety of tasks, which may include any combination of the following: sod laying, mowing, trimming, planting, watering, fertilizing, digging, raking, sprinkler installation, and installation of mortarless segmental concrete masonry wall units.
37-3011.ex: Greenskeeper, Hedge Trimmer, Lawn Caretaker, Shrub Planter
37-3011.title: Landscaping and Groundskeeping Workers

37-3012.desc: Mix or apply pesticides, herbicides, fungicides, or insecticides through sprays, dusts, vapors, soil incorporation, or chemical application on trees, shrubs, lawns, or crops. Usually requires specific training and state or federal certification. Crop dusters are included in "Commercial Pilots" (53-2012).
37-3012.title: Pesticide Handlers, Sprayers, and Applicators, Vegetation

37-3013.desc: Using sophisticated climbing and rigging techniques, cut away dead or excess branches from trees or shrubs to maintain right-of-way for roads, sidewalks, or utilities, or to improve appearance, health, and value of tree. Prune or treat trees or shrubs using handsaws, hand pruners, clippers, and power pruners. Works off the ground in the tree canopy and may use truck-mounted lifts.
37-3013.ex: Tree Specialist, Tree Surgeon, Utility Arborist
37-3013.title: Tree Trimmers and Pruners

37-3019.desc: All grounds maintenance workers not listed separately.
37-3019.ex: Trailhead Maintenance Worker, Tree Trimmer Helper
37-3019.title: Grounds Maintenance Workers, All Other

39-1000._label: Supervisors of Personal Care and Service Workers

39-1010._label: First-Line Supervisors of Entertainment and Recreation Workers

39-1013.desc: Directly supervise and coordinate activities of workers in assigned gambling areas. May circulate among tables, observe operations, and ensure that stations and games are covered for each shift. May verify and pay off jackpots. May reset slot machines after payoffs and make repairs or adjustments to slot machines or recommend removal of slot machines for repair. May plan and organize activities and services for guests in hotels/casinos.
39-1013.ex: Cardroom Supervisor, Casino Slot Supervisor, Electronic Gambling Device Supervisor, Pit Boss, Slot Key Person, Table Games Supervisor
39-1013.title: First-Line Supervisors of Gambling Services Workers

39-1014.desc: Directly supervise and coordinate activities of entertainment and recreation related workers.
39-1014.ex: Arcade Supervisor, Caddy Master, Recreation Attendant Supervisor
39-1014.title: First-Line Supervisors of Entertainment and Recreation Workers, Except Gambling Services

39-1020._label: First-Line Supervisors of Personal Service Workers

39-1022.desc: Supervise and coordinate activities of personal service workers.
39-1022.ex: Animal Trainer Supervisor, Child Care Worker Supervisor, Hair Salon Supervisor
39-1022.title: First-Line Supervisors of Personal Service Workers

39-2011.desc: Train animals for riding, harness, security, performance, or obedience, or for assisting persons with disabilities. Accustom animals to human voice and contact, and condition animals to respond to commands. Train animals according to prescribed standards for show or competition. May train animals to carry pack loads or work as part of pack team.
39-2011.ex: Guide Dog Trainer, Horse Breaker, Marine Mammal Trainer
39-2011.title: Animal Trainers

39-2021.desc: Feed, water, groom, bathe, exercise, or otherwise provide care to promote and maintain the well-being of pets and other animals that are not raised for consumption, such as dogs, cats, race horses, ornamental fish or birds, zoo animals, and mice. Work in settings such as kennels, animal shelters, zoos, circuses, and aquariums. May keep records of feedings, treatments, and animals received or discharged. May clean, disinfect, and repair cages, pens, or fish tanks.
39-2021.ex: Animal Shelter Worker, Dog Groomer, Kennel Worker, Zookeeper
39-2021.title: Animal Caretakers

39-3011.desc: Operate table games. Stand or sit behind table and operate games of chance by dispensing the appropriate number of cards or blocks to players, or operating other gambling equipment. Distribute winnings or collect players' money or chips. May compare the house's hand against players' hands.
39-3011.ex: Blackjack Dealer, Craps Dealer, Poker Dealer, Roulette Dealer
39-3011.title: Gambling Dealers

39-3012.desc: Post information enabling patrons to wager on various races and sporting events. Assist in the operation of games such as keno and bingo. May operate random number-generating equipment and announce the numbers for patrons. Receive, verify, and record patrons' wagers. Scan and process winning tickets presented by patrons and pay out winnings for those wagers.
39-3012.ex: Betting Clerk ,Bingo Worker, Keno Runner, Race Book Writer
39-3012.title: Gambling and Sports Book Writers and Runners

39-3019.desc: All gambling service workers not listed separately.
39-3019.title: Gambling Service Workers, All Other

39-3021.desc: Set up and operate motion picture projection and related sound reproduction equipment.
39-3021.title: Motion Picture Projectionists

39-3030._label: Ushers, Lobby Attendants, and Ticket Takers

39-3031.desc: Assist patrons at entertainment events by performing duties, such as collecting admission tickets and passes from patrons, assisting in finding seats, searching for lost articles, and helping patrons locate such facilities as restrooms and telephones.
39-3031.title: Ushers, Lobby Attendants, and Ticket Takers

39-3090._label: Miscellaneous Entertainment Attendants and Related Workers

39-3091.desc: Perform a variety of attending duties at amusement or recreation facility. May schedule use of recreation facilities, maintain and provide equipment to participants of sporting events or recreational pursuits, or operate amusement concessions and rides.
39-3091.ex: Arcade Attendant, Golf Caddy, Ski Lift Operator
39-3091.title: Amusement and Recreation Attendants

39-3092.desc: Select, fit, and take care of costumes for cast members, and aid entertainers. May assist with multiple costume changes during performances.
39-3092.title: Costume Attendants

39-3093.desc: Provide personal items to patrons or customers in locker rooms, dressing rooms, or coatrooms.
39-3093.ex: Bathhouse Attendant, Coat Checker, Washroom Attendant
39-3093.title: Locker Room, Coatroom, and Dressing Room Attendants

39-3099.desc: All entertainment attendants and related workers not listed separately.
39-3099.title: Entertainment Attendants and Related Workers, All Other

39-4011.desc: Prepare bodies for interment in conformity with legal requirements.
39-4011.title: Embalmers

39-4012.desc: Operate crematory equipment to reduce human or animal remains to bone fragments in accordance with state and local regulations. Duties may include preparing the body for cremation and performing general maintenance on crematory equipment. May use traditional flame-based cremation, calcination, or alkaline hydrolysis.
39-4012.title: Crematory Operators

39-4021.desc: Perform a variety of tasks during funeral, such as placing casket in parlor or chapel prior to service, arranging floral offerings or lights around casket, directing or escorting mourners, closing casket, and issuing and storing funeral equipment.
39-4021.ex: Funeral Home Assistant, Mortician Helper, Pallbearer
39-4021.title: Funeral Attendants

39-4031.desc: Perform various tasks to arrange and direct individual funeral services, such as coordinating transportation of body to mortuary, interviewing family or other authorized person to arrange details, selecting pallbearers, aiding with the selection of officials for religious rites, and providing transportation for mourners.
39-4031.title: Morticians, Undertakers, and Funeral Arrangers

39-5011.desc: Provide barbering services, such as cutting, trimming, shampooing, and styling hair; trimming beards; or giving shaves.
39-5011.title: Barbers

39-5012.desc: Provide beauty services, such as cutting, coloring, and styling hair, and massaging and treating scalp. May shampoo hair, apply makeup, dress wigs, remove hair, and provide nail and skincare services.
39-5012.title: Hairdressers, Hairstylists, and Cosmetologists

39-5091.desc: Apply makeup to performers to reflect period, setting, and situation of their role.
39-5091.title: Makeup Artists, Theatrical and Performance

39-5092.desc: Clean and shape customers' fingernails and toenails. May polish or decorate nails.
39-5092.title: Manicurists and Pedicurists

39-5094.desc: Provide skincare treatments to face and body to enhance an individual's appearance. Includes electrologists and laser hair removal specialists.
39-5094.title: Skincare Specialists

39-6011.desc: Handle baggage for travelers at transportation terminals or for guests at hotels or similar establishments.
39-6011.title: Baggage Porters and Bellhops

39-6012.desc: Assist patrons at hotel, apartment, or office building with personal services. May take messages; arrange or give advice on transportation, business services, or entertainment; or monitor guest requests for housekeeping and maintenance.
39-6012.ex: Activities Concierge, Hotel Concierge, Hotel Guest Service Agent
39-6012.title: Concierges

39-7011.desc: Escort individuals or groups on sightseeing tours or through places of interest, such as industrial establishments, public buildings, and art galleries.
39-7011.ex: Historical Site Guide, Museum Guide, Sightseeing Guide
39-7011.title: Tour Guides and Escorts

39-7012.desc: Plan, organize, and conduct long-distance travel, tours, and expeditions for individuals and groups.
39-7012.title: Travel Guides

39-9000._label: Other Personal Care and Service Workers

39-9011.desc: Attend to children at schools, businesses, private households, and childcare institutions. Perform a variety of tasks, such as dressing, feeding, bathing, and overseeing play.
39-9011.title: Childcare Workers

39-9031.desc: Instruct or coach groups or individuals in exercise activities for the primary purpose of personal fitness. Demonstrate techniques and form, observe participants, and explain to them corrective measures necessary to improve their skills. Develop and implement individualized approaches to exercise.
39-9031.ex: Aerobics Instructor, Personal Trainer, Yoga Instructor
39-9031.title: Exercise Trainers and Group Fitness Instructors

39-9032.desc: Conduct recreation activities with groups in public, private, or volunteer agencies or recreation facilities. Organize and promote activities, such as arts and crafts, sports, games, music, dramatics, social recreation, camping, and hobbies, taking into account the needs and interests of individual members.
39-9032.title: Recreation Workers

39-9041.desc: Coordinate activities in resident facilities in secondary school and college dormitories, group homes, or similar establishments. Order supplies and determine need for maintenance, repairs, and furnishings. May maintain household records and assign rooms. May assist residents with problem solving or refer them to counseling resources.
39-9041.ex: Dormitory Counselor, House Parent, Residence Life Coordinator
39-9041.title: Residential Advisors

39-9090._label: Miscellaneous Personal Care and Service Workers

39-9099.desc: All personal care and service workers not listed separately.
39-9099.ex: Butler, House Sitter, Shoe Shiner, Valet
39-9099.title: Personal Care and Service Workers, All Other

41-1011.desc: Directly supervise and coordinate activities of retail sales workers in an establishment or department. Duties may include management functions, such as purchasing, budgeting, accounting, and personnel work, in addition to supervisory duties.
41-1011.title: First-Line Supervisors of Retail Sales Workers

41-1012.desc: Directly supervise and coordinate activities of sales workers other than retail sales workers. May perform duties such as budgeting, accounting, and personnel work, in addition to supervisory duties.
41-1012.ex: Insurance Sales Supervisor, Real Estate Sales Supervisor, Telemarketer Supervisor
41-1012.title: First-Line Supervisors of Non-Retail Sales Workers

41-2011.desc: Receive and disburse money in establishments other than financial institutions. May use electronic scanners, cash registers, or related equipment. May process credit or debit card transactions and validate checks.
41-2011.ex: Cash Register Operator, Grocery Checker, Toll Collector
41-2011.title: Cashiers

41-2012.desc: Exchange coins, tokens, and chips for patrons' money. May issue payoffs and obtain customer's signature on receipt. May operate a booth in the slot machine area and furnish change persons with money bank at the start of the shift, or count and audit money in drawers.
41-2012.title: Gambling Change Persons and Booth Cashiers

41-2020._label: Counter and Rental Clerks and Parts Salespersons

41-2021.desc: Receive orders, generally in person, for repairs, rentals, and services. May describe available options, compute cost, and accept payment.
41-2021.ex: Automotive Service Writer, Car Rental Agent, Dry Cleaning Counter Clerk
41-2021.title: Counter and Rental Clerks

41-2022.desc: Sell spare and replacement parts and equipment in repair shop or parts store.
41-2022.ex: Auto Parts Salesperson, Electronic Parts Salesperson
41-2022.title: Parts Salespersons

41-2031.desc: Sell merchandise, such as furniture, motor vehicles, appliances, or apparel to consumers.
41-2031.ex: Used Car Salesperson, Women's Apparel Salesperson
41-2031.title: Retail Salespersons

41-3011.desc: Sell or solicit advertising space, time, or media in publications, signage, TV, radio, or Internet establishments or public spaces.
41-3011.ex: Advertising Account Executive, Display Advertising Sales Representative, Yellow Pages Space Salesperson
41-3011.title: Advertising Sales Agents

41-3021.desc: Sell life, property, casualty, health, automotive, or other types of insurance. May refer clients to independent brokers, work as an independent broker, or be employed by an insurance company.
41-3021.title: Insurance Sales Agents

41-3030._label: Securities, Commodities, and Financial Services Sales Agents

41-3031.desc: Buy and sell securities or commodities in investment and trading firms, or provide financial services to businesses and individuals. May advise customers about stocks, bonds, mutual funds, commodities, and market conditions.
41-3031.ex: Foreign Exchange Trader, Investment Banker, Securities Trader, Stock Broker
41-3031.title: Securities, Commodities, and Financial Services Sales Agents

41-3041.desc: Plan and sell transportation and accommodations for customers. Determine destination, modes of transportation, travel dates, costs, and accommodations required. May also describe, plan, and arrange itineraries and sell tour packages. May assist in resolving clients' travel problems.
41-3041.ex: Corporate Travel Expert, Travel Service Consultant
41-3041.title: Travel Agents

41-3091.desc: Sell services to individuals or businesses. May describe options or resolve client problems.
41-3091.ex: Business Services Sales Representative, Membership Solicitor, Pest Control Service Sales Agent
41-3091.title: Sales Representatives of Services, Except Advertising, Insurance, Financial Services, and Travel

41-4011.desc: Sell goods for wholesalers or manufacturers where technical or scientific knowledge is required in such areas as biology, engineering, chemistry, and electronics, normally obtained from at least 2 years of postsecondary education.
41-4011.ex: Pharmaceutical Sales Representative, Surgical Instruments Sales Representative, Wholesale Ultrasonic Equipment Salesperson
41-4011.title: Sales Representatives, Wholesale and Manufacturing, Technical and Scientific Products

41-4012.desc: Sell goods for wholesalers or manufacturers to businesses or groups of individuals. Work requires substantial knowledge of items sold.
41-4012.ex: Hotel Supplies Salesperson, Pulpwood Dealer, Wholesale Diamond Broker
41-4012.title: Sales Representatives, Wholesale and Manufacturing, Except Technical and Scientific Products

41-9011.desc: Demonstrate merchandise and answer questions for the purpose of creating public interest in buying the product. May sell demonstrated merchandise.
41-9011.title: Demonstrators and Product Promoters

41-9012.desc: Model garments or other apparel and accessories for prospective buyers at fashion shows, private showings, or retail establishments. May pose for photos to be used in magazines or advertisements. May pose as subject for paintings, sculptures, and other types of artistic expression.
41-9012.ex: Fashion Model, Hand Model, Photographer's Model
41-9012.title: Models

41-9020._label: Real Estate Brokers and Sales Agents

41-9021.desc: Operate real estate office, or work for commercial real estate firm, overseeing real estate transactions. Other duties usually include selling real estate or renting properties and arranging loans.
41-9021.title: Real Estate Brokers

41-9022.desc: Rent, buy, or sell property for clients. Perform duties such as study property listings, interview prospective clients, accompany clients to property site, discuss conditions of sale, and draw up real estate contracts. Includes agents who represent buyer.
41-9022.ex: Apartment Rental Agent, Right of Way Agent
41-9022.title: Real Estate Sales Agents

41-9031.desc: Sell business goods or services, the selling of which requires a technical background equivalent to a baccalaureate degree in engineering.
41-9031.ex: Aerospace Products Sales Engineer, Missile Navigation Systems Sales Engineer, Nuclear Equipment Sales Engineer
41-9031.title: Sales Engineers

41-9041.desc: Solicit donations or orders for goods or services over the telephone.
41-9041.title: Telemarketers

41-9091.desc: Sell goods or services door-to-door or on the street.
41-9091.ex: Newspaper Carrier, Peddler, Souvenir Street Vendor
41-9091.title: Door-to-Door Sales Workers, News and Street Vendors, and Related Workers

41-9099.desc: All sales and related workers not listed separately.
41-9099.ex: Auctioneer, Blood Donor Recruiter, Pawn Shop Clerk, Personal Shopper, Store Gift Wrap Associate
41-9099.title: Sales and Related Workers, All Other

43-1000._label: Supervisors of Office and Administrative Support Workers

43-1010._label: First-Line Supervisors of Office and Administrative Support Workers

43-1011.desc: Directly supervise and coordinate the activities of clerical and administrative support workers.
43-1011.ex: Clerical Supervisor, Payroll Supervisor, Teller Supervisor
43-1011.title: First-Line Supervisors of Office and Administrative Support Workers

43-2011.desc: Operate telephone business systems equipment or switchboards to relay incoming, outgoing, and interoffice calls. May supply information to callers and record messages.
43-2011.ex: Private Branch Exchange Operator, Telephone Answering Service Operator, Telephone Switchboard Operator
43-2011.title: Switchboard Operators, Including Answering Service

43-2021.desc: Provide information by accessing alphabetical, geographical, or other directories. Assist customers with special billing requests, such as charges to a third party and credits or refunds for incorrectly dialed numbers or bad connections. May handle emergency calls and assist children or people with physical disabilities to make telephone calls.
43-2021.ex: Directory Assistance Operator, Information Operator, Long Distance Operator
43-2021.title: Telephone Operators

43-2099.desc: All communications equipment operators not listed separately.
43-2099.title: Communications Equipment Operators, All Other

43-3011.desc: Locate and notify customers of delinquent accounts by mail, telephone, or personal visit to solicit payment. Duties include receiving payment and posting amount to customer's account, preparing statements to credit department if customer fails to respond, initiating repossession proceedings or service disconnection, and keeping records of collection and status of accounts.
43-3011.title: Bill and Account Collectors

43-3021.desc: Compile, compute, and record billing, accounting, statistical, and other numerical data for billing purposes. Prepare billing invoices for services rendered or for delivery or shipment of goods.
43-3021.title: Billing and Posting Clerks

43-3031.desc: Compute, classify, and record numerical data to keep financial records complete. Perform any combination of routine calculating, posting, and verifying duties to obtain primary financial data for use in maintaining accounting records. May also check the accuracy of figures, calculations, and postings pertaining to business transactions recorded by other workers.
43-3031.ex: Accounts Receivable Clerk, Bookkeeper, Mortgage Accounting Clerk
43-3031.title: Bookkeeping, Accounting, and Auditing Clerks

43-3041.desc: In a gambling establishment, conduct financial transactions for patrons. Accept patron's credit application and verify credit references to provide check-cashing authorization or to establish house credit accounts. May reconcile daily summaries of transactions to balance books. May sell gambling chips, tokens, or tickets to patrons, or to other workers for resale to patrons. May convert gambling chips, tokens, or tickets to currency upon patron's request. May use a cash register or computer to record transaction.
43-3041.title: Gambling Cage Workers

43-3051.desc: Compile and record employee time and payroll data. May compute employees' time worked, production, and commission. May compute and post wages and deductions, or prepare paychecks.
43-3051.title: Payroll and Timekeeping Clerks

43-3061.desc: Compile information and records to draw up purchase orders for procurement of materials and services.
43-3061.title: Procurement Clerks

43-3071.desc: Receive and pay out money. Keep records of money and negotiable instruments involved in a financial institution's various transactions.
43-3071.ex: Foreign Exchange Clerk, Money Order Clerk, Securities Teller
43-3071.title: Tellers

43-3099.desc: All financial clerks not listed separately.
43-3099.ex: Bank Vault Attendant, Financial Reserve Clerk, Safety Deposit Clerk
43-3099.title: Financial Clerks, All Other

43-4011.desc: Perform duties related to the purchase, sale, or holding of securities. Duties include writing orders for stock purchases or sales, computing transfer taxes, verifying stock transactions, accepting and delivering securities, tracking stock price fluctuations, computing equity, distributing dividends, and keeping records of daily transactions and holdings.
43-4011.title: Brokerage Clerks

43-4021.desc: Compose letters or electronic correspondence in reply to requests for merchandise, damage claims, credit and other information, delinquent accounts, incorrect billings, or unsatisfactory services. Duties may include gathering data to formulate reply and preparing correspondence.
43-4021.ex: Fan Mail Editor, Medicare Correspondence Representative
43-4021.title: Correspondence Clerks

43-4031.desc: Perform clerical duties for courts of law, municipalities, or governmental licensing agencies and bureaus. May prepare docket of cases to be called; secure information for judges and court; prepare draft agendas or bylaws for town or city council; answer official correspondence; keep fiscal records and accounts; issue licenses or permits; and record data, administer tests, or collect fees. Clerks of Court are classified in "Managers, All Other" (11-9199).
43-4031.ex: Circuit Court Clerk, Motor Vehicle License Clerk, Warrant Clerk
43-4031.title: Court, Municipal, and License Clerks

43-4041.desc: Authorize credit charges against customers' accounts. Investigate history and credit standing of individuals or business establishments applying for credit. May interview applicants to obtain personal and financial data, determine credit worthiness, process applications, and notify customers of acceptance or rejection of credit.
43-4041.ex: Charge Authorizer, Commercial Credit Reviewer, Credit Rating Checker
43-4041.title: Credit Authorizers, Checkers, and Clerks

43-4051.desc: Interact with customers to provide basic or scripted information in response to routine inquiries about products and services. May handle and resolve general complaints.
43-4051.ex: Customer Complaint Clerk, Passenger Relations Representative, Warranty Clerk
43-4051.title: Customer Service Representatives

43-4061.desc: Determine eligibility of persons applying to receive assistance from government programs and agency resources, such as welfare, unemployment benefits, social security, and public housing.
43-4061.ex: Medicare Interviewer, Public Housing Interviewer, Unemployment Benefits Claims Taker
43-4061.title: Eligibility Interviewers, Government Programs

43-4071.desc: File correspondence, cards, invoices, receipts, and other records in alphabetical or numerical order or according to the filing system used. Locate and remove material from file when requested.
43-4071.title: File Clerks

43-4080._label: Hotel, Motel, and Resort Desk Clerks

43-4081.desc: Accommodate hotel, motel, and resort patrons by registering and assigning rooms to guests, issuing room keys or cards, transmitting and receiving messages, keeping records of occupied rooms and guests' accounts, making and confirming reservations, and presenting statements to and collecting payments from departing guests.
43-4081.ex: Hotel Front Desk Clerk, Hotel Registration Clerk
43-4081.title: Hotel, Motel, and Resort Desk Clerks

43-4111.desc: Interview persons by telephone, mail, in person, or by other means for the purpose of completing forms, applications, or questionnaires. Ask specific questions, record answers, and assist persons with completing form. May sort, classify, and file forms.
43-4111.ex: Census Taker, Market Research Interviewer, Outpatient Interviewing Clerk
43-4111.title: Interviewers, Except Eligibility and Loan

43-4121.desc: Compile records, and sort, shelve, issue, and receive library materials such as books, electronic media, pictures, cards, slides and microfilm. Locate library materials for loan and replace material in shelving area, stacks, or files according to identification number and title. Register patrons to permit them to borrow books, periodicals, and other library materials.
43-4121.ex: Braille and Talking Books Clerk, Circulation Clerk, Microfilm Clerk
43-4121.title: Library Assistants, Clerical

43-4131.desc: Interview loan applicants to elicit information; investigate applicants' backgrounds and verify references; prepare loan request papers; and forward findings, reports, and documents to appraisal department. Review loan papers to ensure completeness, and complete transactions between loan establishment, borrowers, and sellers upon approval of loan.
43-4131.title: Loan Interviewers and Clerks

43-4141.desc: Interview persons desiring to open accounts in financial institutions. Explain account services available to prospective customers and assist them in preparing applications.
43-4141.ex: Banking Services Clerk, New Accounts Banking Representative
43-4141.title: New Accounts Clerks

43-4151.desc: Receive and process incoming orders for materials, merchandise, classified ads, or services such as repairs, installations, or rental of facilities. Generally receives orders via mail, phone, fax, or other electronic means. Duties include informing customers of receipt, prices, shipping dates, and delays; preparing contracts; and handling complaints.
43-4151.ex: Catalogue Clerk, Classified Ad Clerk, Subscription Clerk
43-4151.title: Order Clerks

43-4160._label: Human Resources Assistants, Except Payroll and Timekeeping

43-4161.desc: Compile and keep personnel records. Record data for each employee, such as address, weekly earnings, absences, amount of sales or production, supervisory reports, and date of and reason for termination. May prepare reports for employment records, file employment records, or search employee files and furnish information to authorized persons.
43-4161.title: Human Resources Assistants, Except Payroll and Timekeeping

43-4171.desc: Answer inquiries and provide information to the general public, customers, visitors, and other interested parties regarding activities conducted at establishment and location of departments, offices, and employees within the organization.
43-4171.ex: Appointment Clerk, Front Desk Receptionist, Land Leasing Information Clerk
43-4171.title: Receptionists and Information Clerks

43-4180._label: Reservation and Transportation Ticket Agents and Travel Clerks

43-4181.desc: Make and confirm reservations for transportation or lodging, or sell transportation tickets. May check baggage and direct passengers to designated concourse, pier, or track; deliver tickets and contact individuals and groups to inform them of package tours; or provide tourists with travel or transportation information. Excludes "Cashiers" (41-2011), "Travel Agents" (41-3041), and "Hotel, Motel, and Resort Desk Clerks" (43-4081) who sell tickets for local transport
43-4181.ex: Airline Ticket Agent, Gate Agent, Hotel Reservationist, Train Reservation Clerk
43-4181.title: Reservation and Transportation Ticket Agents and Travel Clerks

43-4199.desc: All information and record clerks not listed separately.
43-4199.ex: Election Clerk, Probate Clerk, Student Admissions Clerk
43-4199.title: Information and Record Clerks, All Other

43-5000._label: Material Recording, Scheduling, Dispatching, and Distributing Workers

43-5011.desc: Expedite and route movement of incoming and outgoing cargo and freight shipments in airline, train, and trucking terminals and shipping docks. Take orders from customers and arrange pickup of freight and cargo for delivery to loading platform. Prepare and examine bills of lading to determine shipping charges and tariffs.
43-5011.title: Cargo and Freight Agents

43-5021.desc: Pick up and deliver messages, documents, packages, and other items between offices or departments within an establishment or directly to other business concerns, traveling by foot, bicycle, motorcycle, automobile, or public conveyance.
43-5021.ex: Bicycle Messenger, Laboratory Courier, Office Runner
43-5021.title: Couriers and Messengers

43-5031.desc: Operate telephone, radio, or other communication systems to receive and communicate requests for emergency assistance at 9-1-1 public safety answering points and emergency operations centers. Take information from the public and other sources regarding crimes, threats, disturbances, acts of terrorism, fires, medical emergencies, and other public safety matters. May coordinate and provide information to law enforcement and emergency response personnel. May access sensitive databases and other information sources as needed. May provide additional instructions to callers based on knowledge of and certification in law enforcement, fire, or emergency medical procedures.
43-5031.ex: 911 Operator, Emergency Operator, Public Safety Dispatcher, Public Safety Telecommunicator
43-5031.title: Public Safety Telecommunicators

43-5032.desc: Schedule and dispatch workers, work crews, equipment, or service vehicles for conveyance of materials, freight, or passengers, or for normal installation, service, or emergency repairs rendered outside the place of business. Duties may include using radio, telephone, or computer to transmit assignments and compiling statistics and reports on work progress.
43-5032.ex: Taxicab Dispatcher, Tow Truck Dispatcher, Train Dispatcher
43-5032.title: Dispatchers, Except Police, Fire, and Ambulance

43-5041.desc: Read meter and record consumption of electricity, gas, water, or steam.
43-5041.ex: Electric Meter Reader, Gas Meter Reader, Water Meter Reader
43-5041.title: Meter Readers, Utilities

43-5051.desc: Perform any combination of tasks in a United States Postal Service (USPS) post office, such as receive letters and parcels; sell postage and revenue stamps, postal cards, and stamped envelopes; fill out and sell money orders; place mail in pigeon holes of mail rack or in bags; and examine mail for correct postage. Includes postal service clerks employed by USPS contractors.
43-5051.ex: Bulk Mail Clerk, Parcel Post Clerk, Postal Service Window Clerk
43-5051.title: Postal Service Clerks

43-5052.desc: Sort and deliver mail for the United States Postal Service (USPS). Deliver mail on established route by vehicle or on foot. Includes postal service mail carriers employed by USPS contractors.
43-5052.ex: Letter Carrier, Mail Deliverer, Rural Route Carrier
43-5052.title: Postal Service Mail Carriers

43-5053.desc: Prepare incoming and outgoing mail for distribution for the United States Postal Service (USPS). Examine, sort, and route mail. Load, operate, and occasionally adjust and repair mail processing, sorting, and canceling machinery. Keep records of shipments, pouches, and sacks, and perform other duties related to mail handling within the postal service. Includes postal service mail sorters and processors employed by USPS contractors.
43-5053.ex: Flat Sorting Machine Clerk, Mail Forwarding System Markup Clerk
43-5053.title: Postal Service Mail Sorters, Processors, and Processing Machine Operators

43-5061.desc: Coordinate and expedite the flow of work and materials within or between departments of an establishment according to production schedule. Duties include reviewing and distributing production, work, and shipment schedules; conferring with department supervisors to determine progress of work and completion dates; and compiling reports on progress of work, inventory levels, costs, and production problems.
43-5061.ex: Expeditor, Material Control Clerk, Production Scheduler
43-5061.title: Production, Planning, and Expediting Clerks

43-5071.desc: Verify and maintain records on incoming and outgoing shipments involving inventory. Duties include verifying and recording incoming merchandise or material and arranging for the transportation of products. May prepare items for shipment.
43-5071.ex: Incoming Freight Clerk, Route Delivery Clerk, Store Receiving Clerk, Warehouse Clerk
43-5071.title: Shipping, Receiving, and Inventory Clerks

43-5110._label: Weighers, Measurers, Checkers, and Samplers, Recordkeeping

43-5111.desc: Weigh, measure, and check materials, supplies, and equipment for the purpose of keeping relevant records. Duties are primarily clerical by nature. Includes workers who collect and keep record of samples of products or materials.
43-5111.ex: Cheese Weigher, Scale Attendant, Weighing Station Operator
43-5111.title: Weighers, Measurers, Checkers, and Samplers, Recordkeeping

43-6011.desc: Provide high-level administrative support by conducting research, preparing statistical reports, and handling information requests, as well as performing routine administrative functions such as preparing correspondence, receiving visitors, arranging conference calls, and scheduling meetings. May also train and supervise lower-level clerical staff.
43-6011.title: Executive Secretaries and Executive Administrative Assistants

43-6012.desc: Perform secretarial duties using legal terminology, procedures, and documents. Prepare legal papers and correspondence, such as summonses, complaints, motions, and subpoenas. May also assist with legal research.
43-6012.title: Legal Secretaries and Administrative Assistants

43-6013.desc: Perform secretarial duties using specific knowledge of medical terminology and hospital, clinic, or laboratory procedures. Duties may include scheduling appointments, billing patients, and compiling and recording medical charts, reports, and correspondence.
43-6013.title: Medical Secretaries and Administrative Assistants

43-6014.desc: Perform routine administrative functions such as drafting correspondence, scheduling appointments, organizing and maintaining paper and electronic files, or providing information to callers.
43-6014.title: Secretaries and Administrative Assistants, Except Legal, Medical, and Executive

43-9000._label: Other Office and Administrative Support Workers

43-9020._label: Data Entry and Information Processing Workers

43-9021.desc: Operate data entry device, such as keyboard or photo composing perforator. Duties may include verifying data and preparing materials for printing.
43-9021.title: Data Entry Keyers

43-9022.desc: Use word processor, computer, or typewriter to type letters, reports, forms, or other material from rough draft, corrected copy, or voice recording. May perform other clerical duties as assigned.
43-9022.title: Word Processors and Typists

43-9031.desc: Format typescript and graphic elements using computer software to produce publication-ready material.
43-9031.title: Desktop Publishers

43-9040._label: Insurance Claims and Policy Processing Clerks

43-9041.desc: Process new insurance policies, modifications to existing policies, and claims forms. Obtain information from policyholders to verify the accuracy and completeness of information on claims forms, applications and related documents, and company records. Update existing policies and company records to reflect changes requested by policyholders and insurance company representatives.
43-9041.ex: Insurance Policy Issue Clerk, Underwriting Clerk
43-9041.title: Insurance Claims and Policy Processing Clerks

43-9050._label: Mail Clerks and Mail Machine Operators, Except Postal Service

43-9051.desc: Prepare incoming and outgoing mail for distribution. Time-stamp, open, read, sort, and route incoming mail; and address, seal, stamp, fold, stuff, and affix postage to outgoing mail or packages. Duties may also include keeping necessary records and completed forms.
43-9051.ex: Direct Mail Clerk, Mailroom Clerk, Packaging Clerk
43-9051.title: Mail Clerks and Mail Machine Operators, Except Postal Service

43-9061.desc: Perform duties too varied and diverse to be classified in any specific office clerical occupation, requiring knowledge of office systems and procedures. Clerical duties may be assigned in accordance with the office procedures of individual establishments and may include a combination of answering telephones, bookkeeping, typing or word processing, office machine operation, and filing.
43-9061.ex: Administrative Clerk, Office Assistant, Real Estate Clerk
43-9061.title: Office Clerks, General

43-9071.desc: Operate one or more of a variety of office machines, such as photocopying, photographic, and duplicating machines, or other office machines.
43-9071.ex: Coin Wrapping Machine Operator, Copy Machine Operator, Scanning Equipment Operators
43-9071.title: Office Machine Operators, Except Computer

43-9081.desc: Read transcript or proof type setup to detect and mark for correction any grammatical, typographical, or compositional errors. Includes proofreaders of braille.
43-9081.ex: Braille Proofreader, Copy Reader, Editorial Assistant
43-9081.title: Proofreaders and Copy Markers

43-9111.desc: Compile and compute data according to statistical formulas for use in statistical studies. May perform actuarial computations and compile charts and graphs for use by actuaries. Includes actuarial clerks.
43-9111.title: Statistical Assistants

43-9190._label: Miscellaneous Office and Administrative Support Workers

43-9199.desc: All office and administrative support workers not listed separately.
43-9199.ex: Envelope Stuffer, Fingerprint Clerk, Notary Public
43-9199.title: Office and Administrative Support Workers, All Other

45-1000._label: Supervisors of Farming, Fishing, and Forestry Workers

45-1010._label: First-Line Supervisors of Farming, Fishing, and Forestry Workers

45-1011.desc: Directly supervise and coordinate the activities of agricultural, forestry, aquacultural, and related workers.
45-1011.ex: Corral Boss, Cranberry Bog Supervisor, Fish Hatchery Supervisor
45-1011.title: First-Line Supervisors of Farming, Fishing, and Forestry Workers

45-2011.desc: Inspect agricultural commodities, processing equipment, and facilities, and fish and logging operations, to ensure compliance with regulations and laws governing health, quality, and safety.
45-2011.ex: Cattle Examiner, Grain Sampler, Milk Tester
45-2011.title: Agricultural Inspectors

45-2021.desc: Select and breed animals according to their genealogy, characteristics, and offspring. May require knowledge of artificial insemination techniques and equipment use. May involve keeping records on heats, birth intervals, or pedigree.
45-2021.title: Animal Breeders

45-2041.desc: Grade, sort, or classify unprocessed food and other agricultural products by size, weight, color, or condition.
45-2041.ex: Cotton Grader, Egg Grader, Fruit Sorter, Meat Grader
45-2041.title: Graders and Sorters, Agricultural Products

45-2091.desc: Drive and control equipment to support agricultural activities such as tilling soil; planting, cultivating, and harvesting crops; feeding and herding livestock; or removing animal waste. May perform tasks such as crop baling or hay bucking. May operate stationary equipment to perform post-harvest tasks such as husking, shelling, threshing, and ginning.
45-2091.ex: Combine Operator, Feed Mixer Operator, Hay Baler, Tractor Operator
45-2091.title: Agricultural Equipment Operators

45-2092.desc: Manually plant, cultivate, and harvest vegetables, fruits, nuts, horticultural specialties, and field crops. Use hand tools, such as shovels, trowels, hoes, tampers, pruning hooks, shears, and knives. Duties may include tilling soil and applying fertilizers; transplanting, weeding, thinning, or pruning crops; applying pesticides; or cleaning, grading, sorting, packing, and loading harvested products. May construct trellises, repair fences and farm buildings, or participate in irrigation activities.
45-2092.ex: Greenhouse Transplanter, Pecan Gatherer, Pepper Picker
45-2092.title: Farmworkers and Laborers, Crop, Nursery, and Greenhouse

45-2093.desc: Attend to live farm, ranch, open range or aquacultural animals that may include cattle, sheep, swine, goats, horses and other equines, poultry, rabbits, finfish, shellfish, and bees. Attend to animals produced for animal products, such as meat, fur, skins, feathers, eggs, milk, and honey. Duties may include feeding, watering, herding, grazing, milking, castrating, branding, de-beaking, weighing, catching, and loading animals. May maintain records on animals; examine animals to detect diseases and injuries; assist in birth deliveries; and administer medications, vaccinations, or insecticides as appropriate. May clean and maintain animal housing areas. Includes workers who shear wool from sheep and collect eggs in hatcheries.
45-2093.ex: Cattle Brander, Sheep Shearer, Shrimp Pond Laborer
45-2093.title: Farmworkers, Farm, Ranch, and Aquacultural Animals

45-2099.desc: All agricultural workers not listed separately.
45-2099.title: Agricultural Workers, All Other

45-3031.desc: Hunt, trap, catch, or gather wild animals or aquatic animals and plants. May use nets, traps, or other equipment. May haul catch onto ship or other vessel. Aquacultural laborers who work on fish farms are included in "Farmworkers, Farm, Ranch, and Aquacultural Animals" (45-2093).
45-3031.ex: Bird Trapper, Deer Hunter, Predatory Animal Trapper, Seaweed Harvester, Wild Oyster Harvester
45-3031.title: Fishing and Hunting Workers

45-4011.desc: Under supervision, perform manual labor necessary to develop, maintain, or protect areas such as forests, forested areas, woodlands, wetlands, and rangelands through such activities as raising and transporting seedlings; combating insects, pests, and diseases harmful to plant life; and building structures to control water, erosion, and leaching of soil. Includes forester aides, seedling pullers, tree planters, and gatherers of nontimber forestry products such as pine straw.
45-4011.ex: Forestry Laborer, Rangelands Conservation Laborer, Reforestation Worker, Wetlands Conservation Laborer
45-4011.title: Forest and Conservation Workers

45-4021.desc: Use axes or chainsaws to fell trees using knowledge of tree characteristics and cutting techniques to control direction of fall and minimize tree damage.
45-4021.title: Fallers

45-4022.desc: Drive logging tractor or wheeled vehicle equipped with one or more accessories, such as bulldozer blade, frontal shear, grapple, logging arch, cable winches, hoisting rack, or crane boom, to fell tree; to skid, load, unload, or stack logs; or to pull stumps or clear brush. Includes operating stand-alone logging machines, such as log chippers. Logging truck drivers are included in "Heavy and Tractor-Trailer Truck Drivers" (53-3032).
45-4022.ex: Grapple Skidder Operator, Log Hauler, Logging Tractor Operator, Lumber Stacker Operator
45-4022.title: Logging Equipment Operators

45-4023.desc: Grade logs or estimate the marketable content or value of logs or pulpwood in sorting yards, millpond, log deck, or similar locations. Inspect logs for defects or measure logs to determine volume.
45-4023.ex: Log Check Scaler, Timber Estimator, Veneer Grader
45-4023.title: Log Graders and Scalers

45-4029.desc: All logging workers not listed separately.
45-4029.ex: Log Roper, Rigging Slinger, Timber Hand
45-4029.title: Logging Workers, All Other

47-1000._label: Supervisors of Construction and Extraction Workers

47-1010._label: First-Line Supervisors of Construction Trades and Extraction Workers

47-1011.desc: Directly supervise and coordinate activities of construction or extraction workers.
47-1011.ex: Carpenter Supervisor, Quarry Boss, Rig Supervisor, Solar Panel Installation Supervisor
47-1011.title: First-Line Supervisors of Construction Trades and Extraction Workers

47-2011.desc: Construct, assemble, maintain, and repair stationary steam boilers and boiler house auxiliaries. Align structures or plate sections to assemble boiler frame tanks or vats, following blueprints. Work involves use of hand and power tools, plumb bobs, levels, wedges, dogs, or turnbuckles. Assist in testing assembled vessels. Direct cleaning of boilers and boiler furnaces. Inspect and repair boiler fittings, such as safety valves, regulators, automatic-control mechanisms, water columns, and auxiliary machines.
47-2011.ex: Boiler Installer, Boiler Mechanic, Boiler Tester
47-2011.title: Boilermakers

47-2021.desc: Lay and bind building materials, such as brick, structural tile, concrete block, cinder block, glass block, and terra-cotta block, with mortar and other substances, to construct or repair walls, partitions, arches, sewers, and other structures. Installers of mortarless segmental concrete masonry wall units are classified in "Landscaping and Groundskeeping Workers" (37-3011).
47-2021.ex: Adobe Layer, Brick Chimney Builder, Refractory Bricklayer
47-2021.title: Brickmasons and Blockmasons

47-2022.desc: Build stone structures, such as piers, walls, and abutments. Lay walks, curbstones, or special types of masonry for vats, tanks, and floors.
47-2022.ex: Curbstone Setter, Granite Setter, Monument Mason
47-2022.title: Stonemasons

47-2031.desc: Construct, erect, install, or repair structures and fixtures made of wood and comparable materials, such as concrete forms; building frameworks, including partitions, joists, studding, and rafters; and wood stairways, window and door frames, and hardwood floors. May also install cabinets, siding, drywall, and batt or roll insulation. Includes brattice builders who build doors or brattices (ventilation walls or partitions) in underground passageways.
47-2031.ex: Building Carpenter, Custom Wood Stair Builder, Wood Floor Layer
47-2031.title: Carpenters

47-2040._label: Carpet, Floor, and Tile Installers and Finishers

47-2041.desc: Lay and install carpet from rolls or blocks on floors. Install padding and trim flooring materials.
47-2041.title: Carpet Installers

47-2042.desc: Apply blocks, strips, or sheets of shock-absorbing, sound-deadening, or decorative coverings to floors.
47-2042.ex: Composition Floor Layer, Cork Floor Installer, Linoleum Installer, Shock-Absorption Floor Layer
47-2042.title: Floor Layers, Except Carpet, Wood, and Hard Tiles

47-2043.desc: Scrape and sand wooden floors to smooth surfaces using floor scraper and floor sanding machine, and apply coats of finish.
47-2043.ex: Floor Sanding Machine Operator, Floor Scraper, Hardwood Finisher
47-2043.title: Floor Sanders and Finishers

47-2044.desc: Apply hard tile, stone, and comparable materials to walls, floors, ceilings, countertops, and roof decks.
47-2044.ex: Ceramic Tile Installer, Hard Tile Setter, Marble Ceiling Installer, Parquet Floor Layer
47-2044.title: Tile and Stone Setters

47-2050._label: Cement Masons, Concrete Finishers, and Terrazzo Workers

47-2051.desc: Smooth and finish surfaces of poured concrete, such as floors, walks, sidewalks, roads, or curbs using a variety of hand and power tools. Align forms for sidewalks, curbs, or gutters; patch voids; and use saws to cut expansion joints. Installers of mortarless segmental concrete masonry wall units are classified in "Landscaping and Groundskeeping Workers" (37-3011).
47-2051.ex: Cement Patcher, Concrete Floor Installer, Concrete Swimming Pool Installer
47-2051.title: Cement Masons and Concrete Finishers

47-2053.desc: Apply a mixture of cement, sand, pigment, or marble chips to floors, stairways, and cabinet fixtures to fashion durable and decorative surfaces.
47-2053.ex: Onyx-Chip Terrazzo Worker, Terrazzo Grinder, Terrazzo Setter
47-2053.title: Terrazzo Workers and Finishers

47-2061.desc: Perform tasks involving physical labor at construction sites. May operate hand and power tools of all types: air hammers, earth tampers, cement mixers, small mechanical hoists, surveying and measuring equipment, and a variety of other equipment and instruments. May clean and prepare sites, dig trenches, set braces to support the sides of excavations, erect scaffolding, and clean up rubble, debris, and other waste materials. May assist other craft workers. Construction laborers who primarily assist a particular craft worker are classified under "Helpers, Construction Trades" (47-3010).
47-2061.ex: Air Hammer Operator, Construction Craft Laborer, Construction Trench Digger
47-2061.title: Construction Laborers

47-2071.desc: Operate equipment used for applying concrete, asphalt, or other materials to road beds, parking lots, or airport runways and taxiways or for tamping gravel, dirt, or other materials. Includes concrete and asphalt paving machine operators, form tampers, tamping machine operators, and stone spreader operators.
47-2071.title: Paving, Surfacing, and Tamping Equipment Operators

47-2072.desc: Operate pile drivers mounted on skids, barges, crawler treads, or locomotive cranes to drive pilings for retaining walls, bulkheads, and foundations of structures such as buildings, bridges, and piers.
47-2072.ex: Hydraulic Pile Hammer Operator, Vibratory Pile Driver
47-2072.title: Pile Driver Operators

47-2073.desc: Operate one or several types of power construction equipment, such as motor graders, bulldozers, scrapers, compressors, pumps, derricks, shovels, tractors, or front-end loaders to excavate, move, and grade earth, erect structures, or pour concrete or other hard surface pavement. May repair and maintain equipment in addition to other duties.
47-2073.ex: Construction Bulldozer Operator, Road Grader, Steam Shovel Operator
47-2073.title: Operating Engineers and Other Construction Equipment Operators

47-2080._label: Drywall Installers, Ceiling Tile Installers, and Tapers

47-2081.desc: Apply plasterboard or other wallboard to ceilings or interior walls of buildings. Apply or mount acoustical tiles or blocks, strips, or sheets of shock-absorbing materials to ceilings and walls of buildings to reduce or reflect sound. Materials may be of decorative quality. Includes lathers who fasten wooden, metal, or rockboard lath to walls, ceilings, or partitions of buildings to provide support base for plaster, fireproofing, or acoustical material.
47-2081.ex: Acoustical Ceiling Installer, Drywall Finisher, Sheet Rock Hanger
47-2081.title: Drywall and Ceiling Tile Installers

47-2082.desc: Seal joints between plasterboard or other wallboard to prepare wall surface for painting or papering.
47-2082.ex: Drywall Taper, Sheet Rock Taper, Wall Taper
47-2082.title: Tapers

47-2111.desc: Install, maintain, and repair electrical wiring, equipment, and fixtures. Ensure that work is in accordance with relevant codes. May install or service street lights, intercom systems, or electrical control systems.
47-2111.ex: Electrical Sign Wirer, Master Electrician, Solar Photovoltaic Electrician
47-2111.title: Electricians

47-2121.desc: Install glass in windows, skylights, store fronts, and display cases, or on surfaces, such as building fronts, interior walls, ceilings, and tabletops.
47-2121.ex: Plate Glass Installer, Stained Glass Joiner
47-2121.title: Glaziers

47-2131.desc: Line and cover structures with insulating materials. May work with batt, roll, or blown insulation materials.
47-2131.ex: Ceiling Insulation Blower, Composition Weatherboard Installer, Interior Surface Insulation Worker
47-2131.title: Insulation Workers, Floor, Ceiling, and Wall

47-2132.desc: Apply insulating materials to pipes or ductwork, or other mechanical systems in order to help control and maintain temperature.
47-2132.ex: Boiler Coverer, Pipe Coverer, Pipe Insulator
47-2132.title: Insulation Workers, Mechanical

47-2141.desc: Paint walls, equipment, buildings, bridges, and other structural surfaces, using brushes, rollers, and spray guns. May remove old paint to prepare surface prior to painting. May mix colors or oils to obtain desired color or consistency.
47-2141.ex: Bridge Painter, House Painter, Traffic Line Painter
47-2141.title: Painters, Construction and Maintenance

47-2142.desc: Cover interior walls or ceilings of rooms with decorative wallpaper or fabric, or attach advertising posters on surfaces such as walls and billboards. May remove old materials or prepare surfaces to be papered.
47-2142.ex: Billboard Poster, Wall Covering Installer, Wallpaperer
47-2142.title: Paperhangers

47-2151.desc: Lay pipe for storm or sanitation sewers, drains, and water mains. Perform any combination of the following tasks: grade trenches or culverts, position pipe, or seal joints.
47-2151.ex: Cast-Iron Drain Pipe Layer, Trench Pipe Layer, Water Main Pipe Layer
47-2151.title: Pipelayers

47-2152.desc: Assemble, install, alter, and repair pipelines or pipe systems that carry water, steam, air, or other liquids or gases. May install heating and cooling equipment and mechanical control systems. Includes sprinkler fitters.
47-2152.ex: Fire Sprinkler Installer, Solar Thermal Installer, Sprinkler Fitter
47-2152.title: Plumbers, Pipefitters, and Steamfitters

47-2161.desc: Apply interior or exterior plaster, cement, stucco, or similar materials. May also set ornamental plaster.
47-2161.ex: Ornamental Plasterer, Stucco Worker, Swimming Pool Plasterer
47-2161.title: Plasterers and Stucco Masons

47-2171.desc: Position and secure steel bars or mesh in concrete forms in order to reinforce concrete. Use a variety of fasteners, rod-bending machines, blowtorches, and hand tools. Includes rod busters.
47-2171.ex: Post Tensioning Ironworker, Steel Rod Buster
47-2171.title: Reinforcing Iron and Rebar Workers

47-2181.desc: Cover roofs of structures with shingles, slate, asphalt, aluminum, wood, or related materials. May spray roofs, sidings, and walls with material to bind, seal, insulate, or soundproof sections of structures.
47-2181.ex: Hot Tar Roofer, Shingles Roofer, Terra Cotta Roofer
47-2181.title: Roofers

47-2211.desc: Fabricate, assemble, install, and repair sheet metal products and equipment, such as ducts, control boxes, drainpipes, and furnace casings. Work may involve any of the following: setting up and operating fabricating machines to cut, bend, and straighten sheet metal; shaping metal over anvils, blocks, or forms using hammer; operating soldering and welding equipment to join sheet metal parts; or inspecting, assembling, and smoothing seams and joints of burred surfaces. Includes sheet metal duct installers who install prefabricated sheet metal ducts used for heating, air conditioning, or other purposes.
47-2211.ex: Heating, Ventilation, and Air Conditioning (HVAC) Sheet Metal Installer, Sheet Metal Former, Tinsmith
47-2211.title: Sheet Metal Workers

47-2221.desc: Raise, place, and unite iron or steel girders, columns, and other structural members to form completed structures or structural frameworks. May erect metal storage tanks and assemble prefabricated metal buildings.
47-2221.ex: Bridge Ironworker, Precast Concrete Ironworker, Wind Turbine Erector
47-2221.title: Structural Iron and Steel Workers

47-2231.desc: Assemble, install, or maintain solar photovoltaic (PV) systems on roofs or other structures in compliance with site assessment and schematics. May include measuring, cutting, assembling, and bolting structural framing and solar modules. May perform minor electrical work such as current checks.
47-2231.ex: Photovoltaic (PV) Installation Technician, Solar PV Installer
47-2231.title: Solar Photovoltaic Installers

47-3011.desc: Help brickmasons, blockmasons, stonemasons, or tile and marble setters by performing duties requiring less skill. Duties include using, supplying, or holding materials or tools, and cleaning work area and equipment. Construction laborers who do not primarily assist brickmasons, blockmasons, and stonemasons or tile and marble setters are classified under "Construction Laborers" (47-2061). Apprentice workers are classified with the appropriate skilled construction trade occupation (47-2011 through 47-2231).
47-3011.ex: Brick Carrier, Brick Washer, Refractory Tile Helper
47-3011.title: Helpers--Brickmasons, Blockmasons, Stonemasons, and Tile and Marble Setters

47-3012.desc: Help carpenters by performing duties requiring less skill. Duties include using, supplying, or holding materials or tools, and cleaning work area and equipment. Construction laborers who do not primarily assist carpenters are classified under "Construction Laborers" (47-2061). Apprentice workers are classified with the appropriate skilled construction trade occupation (47-2011 through 47-2231).
47-3012.ex: Carpenter Assistant, Hardwood Floor Installation Helper
47-3012.title: Helpers--Carpenters

47-3013.desc: Help electricians by performing duties requiring less skill. Duties include using, supplying, or holding materials or tools, and cleaning work area and equipment. Construction laborers who do not primarily assist electricians are classified under "Construction Laborers" (47-2061). Apprentice workers are classified with the appropriate skilled construction trade occupation (47-2011 through 47-2231).
47-3013.ex: Marine Electrician Helper, Stage Electrician Helper
47-3013.title: Helpers--Electricians

47-3014.desc: Help painters, paperhangers, plasterers, or stucco masons by performing duties requiring less skill. Duties include using, supplying, or holding materials or tools, and cleaning work area and equipment. Construction laborers who do not primarily assist painters, paperhangers, plasterers, or stucco masons are classified under "Construction Laborers" (47-2061). Apprentice workers are classified with the appropriate skilled construction trade occupation (47-2011 through 47-2231).
47-3014.ex: Bridge Painter Helper, Dry Plasterer Helper, Wallpaperer Helper
47-3014.title: Helpers--Painters, Paperhangers, Plasterers, and Stucco Masons

47-3015.desc: Help plumbers, pipefitters, steamfitters, or pipelayers by performing duties requiring less skill. Duties include using, supplying, or holding materials or tools, and cleaning work area and equipment. Construction laborers who do not primarily assist plumbers, pipefitters, steamfitters, or pipelayers are classified under "Construction Laborers" (47-2061). Apprentice workers are classified with the appropriate skilled construction trade occupation (47-2011 through 47-2231).
47-3015.ex: Industrial Gas Fitter Helper, Marine Pipefitter Helper, Plumber Assistant, Water Main Installer Helper
47-3015.title: Helpers--Pipelayers, Plumbers, Pipefitters, and Steamfitters

47-3016.desc: Help roofers by performing duties requiring less skill. Duties include using, supplying, or holding materials or tools, and cleaning work area and equipment. Construction laborers who do not primarily assist roofers are classified under "Construction Laborers" (47-2061). Apprentice workers are classified with the appropriate skilled construction trade occupation (47-2011 through 47-2231).
47-3016.ex: Hot Tar Roofer Helper, Shingles Roofer Helper, Slate Roofer Helper, Terra Cotta Roofer Helper
47-3016.title: Helpers--Roofers

47-3019.desc: All construction trades helpers not listed separately.
47-3019.ex: Cellulose Insulation Helper, Drywall Hanger Helper, Rod Buster Helper, Terrazzo Finisher Helper
47-3019.title: Helpers, Construction Trades, All Other

47-4011.desc: Inspect structures using engineering skills to determine structural soundness and compliance with specifications, building codes, and other regulations. Inspections may be general in nature or may be limited to a specific area, such as electrical systems or plumbing.
47-4011.ex: Electrical Inspector, Elevator Inspector, Highway Inspector, Home Inspector
47-4011.title: Construction and Building Inspectors

47-4020._label: Elevator and Escalator Installers and Repairers

47-4021.desc: Assemble, install, repair, or maintain electric or hydraulic freight or passenger elevators, escalators, or dumbwaiters.
47-4021.ex: Elevator Mechanic, Escalator Installer, Hydraulic Elevator Constructor
47-4021.title: Elevator and Escalator Installers and Repairers

47-4031.desc: Erect and repair fences and fence gates, using hand and power tools.
47-4031.ex: Wire Fence Builder, Wood Fence Installer
47-4031.title: Fence Erectors

47-4041.desc: Identify, remove, pack, transport, or dispose of hazardous materials, including asbestos, lead-based paint, waste oil, fuel, transmission fluid, radioactive materials, or contaminated soil. Specialized training and certification in hazardous materials handling or a confined entry permit are generally required. May operate earth-moving equipment or trucks.
47-4041.ex: Asbestos Abatement Worker, Decontamination Worker, Irradiated Fuel Handler
47-4041.title: Hazardous Materials Removal Workers

47-4051.desc: Maintain highways, municipal and rural roads, airport runways, and rights-of-way. Duties include patching broken or eroded pavement and repairing guard rails, highway markers, and snow fences. May also mow or clear brush from along road, or plow snow from roadway.
47-4051.title: Highway Maintenance Workers

47-4060._label: Rail-Track Laying and Maintenance Equipment Operators

47-4061.desc: Lay, repair, and maintain track for standard or narrow-gauge railroad equipment used in regular railroad service or in plant yards, quarries, sand and gravel pits, and mines. Includes ballast cleaning machine operators and railroad bed tamping machine operators.
47-4061.ex: Rail Maintenance Worker, Track Repairer, Track Surfacing Machine Operator
47-4061.title: Rail-Track Laying and Maintenance Equipment Operators

47-4070._label: Septic Tank Servicers and Sewer Pipe Cleaners

47-4071.desc: Clean and repair septic tanks, sewer lines, or drains. May patch walls and partitions of tank, replace damaged drain tile, or repair breaks in underground piping.
47-4071.ex: Electric Sewer Cleaning Machine Operator, Septic Tank Cleaner, Sewage Screen Operator
47-4071.title: Septic Tank Servicers and Sewer Pipe Cleaners

47-4091.desc: Lay out, cut, and place segmental paving units. Includes installers of bedding and restraining materials for the paving units.
47-4091.ex: Concrete Pavement Installer, Paving Stone Installer
47-4091.title: Segmental Pavers

47-4099.desc: All construction and related workers not listed separately.
47-4099.title: Construction and Related Workers, All Other

47-5010._label: Derrick, Rotary Drill, and Service Unit Operators, Oil and Gas

47-5011.desc: Rig derrick equipment and operate pumps to circulate mud or fluid through drill hole.
47-5011.ex: Fracturing Derrick Operator, Rotary Derrick Operator, Well Service Derrick Worker
47-5011.title: Derrick Operators, Oil and Gas

47-5012.desc: Set up or operate a variety of drills to remove underground oil and gas, or remove core samples for testing during oil and gas exploration.
47-5012.ex: Fracturing Rotary Drill Operator, Oil Well Cable Tool Operator, Oil Well Driller
47-5012.title: Rotary Drill Operators, Oil and Gas

47-5013.desc: Operate equipment to increase oil flow from producing wells or to remove stuck pipe, casing, tools, or other obstructions from drilling wells. Includes fishing-tool technicians.
47-5013.title: Service Unit Operators, Oil and Gas

47-5020._label: Surface Mining Machine Operators and Earth Drillers

47-5022.desc: Operate or tend machinery at surface mining site, equipped with scoops, shovels, or buckets to excavate and load loose materials.
47-5022.ex: Mining Bulldozer Operator, Mining Shovel Operator
47-5022.title: Excavating and Loading Machine and Dragline Operators, Surface Mining

47-5023.desc: Operate a variety of drills such as rotary, churn, and pneumatic to tap subsurface water and salt deposits, to remove core samples during mineral exploration or soil testing, and to facilitate the use of explosives in mining or construction. Includes horizontal and earth boring machine operators.
47-5023.ex: Blast Hole Driller, Churn Driller, Earth Auger Operator
47-5023.title: Earth Drillers, Except Oil and Gas

47-5030._label: Explosives Workers, Ordnance Handling Experts, and Blasters

47-5032.desc: Place and detonate explosives to demolish structures or to loosen, remove, or displace earth, rock, or other materials. May perform specialized handling, storage, and accounting procedures.
47-5032.ex: Blast Setter, Dynamiter, Explosive Technician, Mining Powder Crew Worker
47-5032.title: Explosives Workers, Ordnance Handling Experts, and Blasters

47-5041.desc: Operate self-propelled mining machines that rip coal, metal and nonmetal ores, rock, stone, or sand from the mine face and load it onto conveyors, shuttle cars, or trucks in a continuous operation.
47-5041.ex: Continuous Mining Machine Lode Miner, Continuous Mining Machine Miner, Self-Propelled Mining Machine Operator
47-5041.title: Continuous Mining Machine Operators

47-5043.desc: Operate machinery to install roof support bolts in underground mine.
47-5043.ex: Roof Bolting Coal Miner, Underground Bolting Machine Operator, Underground Roof Bolter
47-5043.title: Roof Bolters, Mining

47-5044.desc: Operate underground loading or moving machine to load or move coal, ore, or rock using shuttle or mine car or conveyors. Equipment may include power shovels, hoisting engines equipped with cable-drawn scraper or scoop, or machines equipped with gathering arms and conveyor.
47-5044.ex: Coal Hauler Operator, Coke Loader, Mine Shuttle Car Operator, Mobile Bridge Conveyor Operator
47-5044.title: Loading and Moving Machine Operators, Underground Mining

47-5049.desc: All underground mining machine operators not listed separately.
47-5049.ex: Long Wall Operator, Long Wall Shearer, Rock Dust Sprayer, Underground Jumbo Driller
47-5049.title: Underground Mining Machine Operators, All Other

47-5051.desc: Separate blocks of rough dimension stone from quarry mass using jackhammers, wedges, or chop saws.
47-5051.ex: Quarry Chop Saw Operator, Quarry Plug and Feather Driller, Sandstone Splitter
47-5051.title: Rock Splitters, Quarry

47-5071.desc: Assemble or repair oil field equipment using hand and power tools. Perform other tasks as needed.
47-5071.ex: Gas Floorhand, Oil Field Roustabout, Oil Rig Roughneck
47-5071.title: Roustabouts, Oil and Gas

47-5081.desc: Help extraction craft workers, such as earth drillers, blasters and explosives workers, derrick operators, and mining machine operators, by performing duties requiring less skill. Duties include supplying equipment or cleaning work area. Apprentice workers are classified with the appropriate skilled construction trade occupation (47-2011 through 47-2231).
47-5081.ex: Blaster Helper, Mining Helper, Roof Bolter Helper
47-5081.title: Helpers--Extraction Workers

47-5099.desc: All extraction workers not listed separately.
47-5099.ex: Mine Milling Worker, Mine Tailings Worker
47-5099.title: Extraction Workers, All Other

49-1000._label: Supervisors of Installation, Maintenance, and Repair Workers

49-1010._label: First-Line Supervisors of Mechanics, Installers, and Repairers

49-1011.desc: Directly supervise and coordinate the activities of mechanics, installers, and repairers. May also advise customers on recommended services.
49-1011.ex: Automobile Body Repair Supervisor, Fleet Maintenance Supervisor, Railroad Car Repair Supervisor
49-1011.title: First-Line Supervisors of Mechanics, Installers, and Repairers

49-2000._label: Electrical and Electronic Equipment Mechanics, Installers, and Repairers

49-2010._label: Computer, Automated Teller, and Office Machine Repairers

49-2011.desc: Repair, maintain, or install computers, word processing systems, automated teller machines, and electronic office machines, such as duplicating and fax machines.
49-2011.ex: ATM Servicer, Cash Register Servicer, Data Processing Equipment Repairer
49-2011.title: Computer, Automated Teller, and Office Machine Repairers

49-2020._label: Radio and Telecommunications Equipment Installers and Repairers

49-2021.desc: Repair, install, or maintain mobile or stationary radio transmitting, broadcasting, and receiving equipment, and two-way radio communications systems used in cellular telecommunications, mobile broadband, ship-to-shore, aircraft-to-ground communications, and radio equipment in service and emergency vehicles. May test and analyze network coverage.
49-2021.ex: Radio Frequency Technician, Radio Mechanic, Two-Way Radio Technician
49-2021.title: Radio, Cellular, and Tower Equipment Installers and Repairers

49-2022.desc: Install, set up, rearrange, or remove switching, distribution, routing, and dialing equipment used in central offices or headends. Service or repair telephone, cable television, Internet, and other communications equipment on customers' property. May install communications equipment or communications wiring in buildings.
49-2022.ex: Fiber Optic Central Office Installer, Private Branch Exchange (PBX ) Installer and Repairer
49-2022.title: Telecommunications Equipment Installers and Repairers, Except Line Installers

49-2090._label: Miscellaneous Electrical and Electronic Equipment Mechanics, Installers, and Repairers

49-2091.desc: Install, inspect, test, adjust, or repair avionics equipment, such as radar, radio, navigation, and missile control systems in aircraft or space vehicles.
49-2091.ex: Aircraft Electrician, Aircraft Instrument Mechanic, Automatic Pilot Mechanic
49-2091.title: Avionics Technicians

49-2092.desc: Repair, maintain, or install electric motors, wiring, or switches.
49-2092.title: Electric Motor, Power Tool, and Related Repairers

49-2093.desc: Install, adjust, or maintain mobile electronics communication equipment, including sound, sonar, security, navigation, and surveillance systems on trains, watercraft, or other mobile equipment.
49-2093.title: Electrical and Electronics Installers and Repairers, Transportation Equipment

49-2094.desc: Repair, test, adjust, or install electronic equipment, such as industrial controls, transmitters, and antennas.
49-2094.ex: Industrial Robotics Mechanic, Missile Pad Mechanic, Public Address System Mechanic
49-2094.title: Electrical and Electronics Repairers, Commercial and Industrial Equipment

49-2095.desc: Inspect, test, repair, or maintain electrical equipment in generating stations, substations, and in-service relays.
49-2095.ex: Power Transformer Repairer, Powerhouse Electrician, Relay Technician
49-2095.title: Electrical and Electronics Repairers, Powerhouse, Substation, and Relay

49-2096.desc: Install, diagnose, or repair communications, sound, security, or navigation equipment in motor vehicles.
49-2096.ex: Automotive Electrician, Car Alarm Installer, Car Stereo Installer, GPS Car Navigation Installer
49-2096.title: Electronic Equipment Installers and Repairers, Motor Vehicles

49-2097.desc: Install, repair, or adjust audio or television receivers, stereo systems, camcorders, video systems, or other electronic entertainment equipment in homes or other venues. May perform routine maintenance.
49-2097.ex: Electronic Musical Instrument Repairer, Home Theater Installer, Satellite Dish Installer, Wireless Internet Installer
49-2097.title: Audiovisual Equipment Installers and Repairers

49-2098.desc: Install, program, maintain, and repair security and fire alarm wiring and equipment. Ensure that work is in accordance with relevant codes.
49-2098.ex: Burglar Alarm Installer, Fire Alarm Installer, Home Security Alarm Installer
49-2098.title: Security and Fire Alarm Systems Installers

49-3000._label: Vehicle and Mobile Equipment Mechanics, Installers, and Repairers

49-3011.desc: Diagnose, adjust, repair, or overhaul aircraft engines and assemblies, such as hydraulic and pneumatic systems.
49-3011.ex: Aircraft Engine Specialist, Airframe Mechanic, Flight Test Mechanic, Helicopter Engine Mechanic
49-3011.title: Aircraft Mechanics and Service Technicians

49-3021.desc: Repair and refinish automotive vehicle bodies and straighten vehicle frames.
49-3021.ex: Auto Body Customizer, Auto Bumper Straightener, Truck Body Repairer
49-3021.title: Automotive Body and Related Repairers

49-3022.desc: Replace or repair broken windshields and window glass in motor vehicles.
49-3022.ex: Auto Glass Mechanic, Automotive Glazier, Windshield Installer
49-3022.title: Automotive Glass Installers and Repairers

49-3023.desc: Diagnose, adjust, repair, or overhaul automotive vehicles.
49-3023.ex: Auto Transmission Specialist, Automotive Brake Technician, Automotive Fuel Injection Servicer, Hybrid Car Mechanic
49-3023.title: Automotive Service Technicians and Mechanics

49-3030._label: Bus and Truck Mechanics and Diesel Engine Specialists

49-3031.desc: Diagnose, adjust, repair, or overhaul buses and trucks, or maintain and repair any type of diesel engines. Includes mechanics working primarily with automobile or marine diesel engines.
49-3031.ex: Biodiesel Engine Specialist, Marine Diesel Technician, School Bus Mechanic, Tractor Trailer Mechanic
49-3031.title: Bus and Truck Mechanics and Diesel Engine Specialists

49-3040._label: Heavy Vehicle and Mobile Equipment Service Technicians and Mechanics

49-3041.desc: Diagnose, adjust, repair, or overhaul farm machinery and vehicles, such as tractors, harvesters, dairy equipment, and irrigation systems.
49-3041.ex: Combine Mechanic, Dairy Equipment Repairer, Irrigation Equipment Mechanic
49-3041.title: Farm Equipment Mechanics and Service Technicians

49-3042.desc: Diagnose, adjust, repair, or overhaul mobile mechanical, hydraulic, and pneumatic equipment, such as cranes, bulldozers, graders, and conveyors, used in construction, logging, and mining.
49-3042.ex: Bulldozer Mechanic, Construction Equipment Mechanic, Forklift Mechanic
49-3042.title: Mobile Heavy Equipment Mechanics, Except Engines

49-3043.desc: Diagnose, adjust, repair, or overhaul railroad rolling stock, mine cars, or mass transit rail cars.
49-3043.ex: Mine Car Mechanic, Streetcar Repairer, Subway Car Repairer, Trolley Car Overhauler
49-3043.title: Rail Car Repairers

49-3051.desc: Repair and adjust electrical and mechanical equipment of inboard or inboard-outboard boat engines.
49-3051.ex: Certified Marine Mechanic, Outboard Motor Mechanic
49-3051.title: Motorboat Mechanics and Service Technicians

49-3052.desc: Diagnose, adjust, repair, or overhaul motorcycles, scooters, mopeds, dirt bikes, or similar motorized vehicles.
49-3052.ex: All Terrain Vehicle Technician, Motor Scooter Mechanic, Motorcycle Service Technician
49-3052.title: Motorcycle Mechanics

49-3053.desc: Diagnose, adjust, repair, or overhaul small engines used to power lawn mowers, chain saws, recreational sporting equipment, and related equipment.
49-3053.ex: Golf Cart Mechanic, Lawn Mower Repairer, Mobility Scooter Repairer, Power Saw Mechanic
49-3053.title: Outdoor Power Equipment and Other Small Engine Mechanics

49-3090._label: Miscellaneous Vehicle and Mobile Equipment Mechanics, Installers, and Repairers

49-3092.desc: Diagnose, inspect, adjust, repair, or overhaul recreational vehicles including travel trailers. May specialize in maintaining gas, electrical, hydraulic, plumbing, or chassis/towing systems as well as repairing generators, appliances, and interior components. Includes workers who perform customized van conversions.
49-3092.title: Recreational Vehicle Service Technicians

49-9000._label: Other Installation, Maintenance, and Repair Occupations

49-9010._label: Control and Valve Installers and Repairers

49-9011.desc: Install, service, or repair automatic door mechanisms and hydraulic doors. Includes garage door mechanics.
49-9011.title: Mechanical Door Repairers

49-9012.desc: Install, repair, and maintain mechanical regulating and controlling devices, such as electric meters, gas regulators, thermostats, safety and flow valves, and other mechanical governors.
49-9012.ex: Air Valve Mechanic, Gas Meter Installer, Thermostat Repairer
49-9012.title: Control and Valve Installers and Repairers, Except Mechanical Door

49-9020._label: Heating, Air Conditioning, and Refrigeration Mechanics and Installers

49-9021.desc: Install or repair heating, central air conditioning, HVAC, or refrigeration systems, including oil burners, hot-air furnaces, and heating stoves.
49-9021.ex: Gas Furnace Installer, Heating, Ventilation, and Air Conditioning (HVAC) Mechanic, Oil Burner Repairer
